subject: CBSNews Sunday Morning: Plastics -- proliferating and enduring
body:

  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






June 22, 2007
 
It was 40 years ago when the movie ”The 
      Graduate” looked toward the future with one word:
plastics. Little did we know that, today, Americans would consume a billion 
      plastic bags a year. And then there are all those plastic water bottles we 
      walk around with, none of which are 
      biodegradable. Well, you get 
      the picture. John Blackstone will be "Talking Trash" in our Sunday 
      Morning cover story. 
 
We think of honeybees as 
      rather industrious creatures, spending their entire lives transporting 
      pollen, producing honey and reproducing. All that work provides us with 
      30 percent of the food we eat. But honeybees in 
      North 
      America may be in trouble: 
      They are dying off by the thousands, and no one knows why. Martha Teichner 
      reports on the fate of these rather remarkable animals. 
      
 
This summer the rock band The 
      Police is back on tour. It’s yet another triumph for lead singer Sting. 
      Harry Smith caught up with this rock n’ roll legend, who took him along on a musical journey 
      into the past.      
      
 
It’s rare that an independent 
      film cracks the box office top ten, 
      but that is exactly what has happened with the film "Waitress," co-written and directed by Adrienne 
      Shelley. But, as Tracy Smith 
      reports, a bizarre tragedy prevented 
      Shelley from realizing what would have been her dream come true. 
      
 
During the summer, many of us like our coffee ice-cold but, in Seattle, they like it hot all year-round -- 
      really HOT! Bill Geist traveled to the country’s coffee capital to 
      sample the latest innovation in coffee, 
      "Sexpresso”!
 
All that and more, this Sunday 
      Morning.
 
Listen for our 
      trumpet!
